D:/Programming/Projects/depot/SekaiFramework/src/reflection/delegate/Delegate_makedeleg.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 // Also declare overloads of a MakeDelegate() global function to 
00002 // reduce the need for typedefs.
00003 // We need seperate overloads for const and non-const member functions.
00004 // Also, because of the weird rule about the class of derived member function pointers,
00005 // implicit downcasts may need to be applied later to the 'this' pointer.
00006 // That's why two classes (X and Y) appear in the definitions. Y must be implicitly
00007 // castable to X.
00008 
00009 // Workaround for VC6. VC6 needs void return types converted into DefaultVoid.
00010 // GCC 3.2 and later won't compile this unless it's preceded by 'typename',
00011 // but VC6 doesn't allow 'typename' in this context.
00012 // So, I have to use a macro.
00013 
00014 #ifdef FASTDLGT_VC6
00015 #define FASTDLGT_RETTYPE detail::VoidToDefaultVoid<RetType>::type
00016 #else 
00017 #define FASTDLGT_RETTYPE RetType
00018 #endif
00019 
00020 
00021 //N=0
00022 template <class X, class Y, class RetType>
00023 Delegate0<FASTDLGT_RETTYPE> MakeDelegate(Y* x, RetType (X::*func)() DELEG_CONST) { 
00024         return Delegate0<FASTDLGT_RETTYPE>(x, func);
00025 }
00026 
00027 //N=1
00028 template <class X, class Y, class Param1, class RetType>
00029 Delegate1<Param1, FASTDLGT_RETTYPE> MakeDelegate(Y* x, RetType (X::*func)(Param1 p1) DELEG_CONST) { 
00030         return Delegate1<Param1, FASTDLGT_RETTYPE>(x, func);
00031 }
00032

00034 template <class X, class Y, class Param1, class Param2, class RetType>
00035 Delegate2<Param1, Param2, FASTDLGT_RETTYPE> MakeDelegate(Y* x, RetType (X::*func)(Param1 p1, Param2 p2) DELEG_CONST) { 
00036         return Delegate2<Param1, Param2, FASTDLGT_RETTYPE>(x, func);
00037 }
00038

00042         return Delegate3<Param1, Param2, Param3, FASTDLGT_RETTYPE>(x, func);
00043 }
